name: Find Permutation

similar_questions.title: Using a Robot to Print the Lexicographically Smallest String

title: Find Permutation
content:
A permutation perm of n integers of all the integers in the range [1, n] can be represented as a string s of length n - 1 where:

  • s[i] == 'I' if perm[i] < perm[i + 1], and
  • s[i] == 'D' if perm[i] > perm[i + 1].

Given a string s, reconstruct the lexicographically smallest permutation perm and return it.

 

Example 1:

Input: s = "I"
Output: [1,2]
Explanation: [1,2] is the only legal permutation that can represented by s, where the number 1 and 2 construct an increasing relationship.

Example 2:

Input: s = "DI"
Output: [2,1,3]
Explanation: Both [2,1,3] and [3,1,2] can be represented as "DI", but since we want to find the smallest lexicographical permutation, you should return [2,1,3]

 

Constraints:

  • 1 <= s.length <= 105
  • s[i] is either 'I' or 'D'.

discussion_posts.content: Question was unclear and not thorough. So, I typed this question name to ChatGPT and said "Teach me this problem like you are teaching a 5 year old". \nIt did a pretty good job.

discussion_posts.name: chebz
discussion_posts.content: Why for "DI"\n[3,1,2] is wrong?\nBut [2,1,3] is correct?

discussion_posts.name: AndrewZzy
discussion_posts.content: My idea when solving this: See String s as a String combined by parts of DDDDDD...DI(any number of D's, including zero, and one I at the end). Have two iterators, one for the Chars in the String, one for the integer array. In each substring like this, we do the same thing: update the iterators, and keep counting and marking down the number we reached, and put them in the correct positions in the array. In the end, put the corresponding number based on the last Character in the String(D or I). Just an Idea

discussion_posts.name: bramisetty
discussion_posts.content: For those who didn\'t understand the question:\nCreate an array of containing all integers from [1,...,n] where n = length(s) + 1. If a character in S has a D then the next 2 numbers should be in descending order and I = increasing order

discussion_posts.name: moorccini
discussion_posts.content:
From the editorial solution if you don't want to read it but understand this superbly well-written stupid questions asks!

Say, the given pattern sss is "DDIIIID". This corresponds to n=8n=8n=8. Thus, the minimum permutation possible will be [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8]. Now, to satisfy the first two "DD" pattern, we can observe that the best course of action to generate the smallest arrangement will be to rearrange only 1, 2, 3, because these are the smallest numbers that can be placed at the three most significant positions to generate the smallest arrangement satisfying the given pattern till now, leading to the formation of [3, 2, 1, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8] till now. We can note that placing any number larger than 3 at any of these positions will lead to the generation of a lexicographically larger arrangement as discussed above.
